results.title: Metformin alleviates cholestasis-associated nephropathy through regulating oxidative stress and mitochondrial function.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ alleviates @<m>DISEASE_Cholestasis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002779 @@@cholestasis@@@-associated @DISEASE_Kidney_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D007674 @@@nephropathy@@@ through regulating oxidative stress and mitochondrial function.

results.title: Literature review of the clinical characteristics of metformin-induced hepatotoxicity
results.text_hl: The type of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@-induced hepatotoxicity is not specific and can result in hepatocellular, @<m>DISEASE_Cholestasis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002779 @@@cholestasis@@@, or mixed @DISEASE_Liver_Failure @DISEASE_MESH:D017093 @@@hepatocellular liver injury@@@.

citations.NLM: Wang C, Deng H, Xu Y, Liu Y. Literature review of the clinical characteristics of metformin-induced hepatotoxicity Front Pharmacol. 2022;13():969505. PMID: 36147344

results.title: Metformin Disrupts Bile Acid Efflux by Repressing Bile Salt Export Pump Expression.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: Repression of @GENE_ABCB11 @GENE_8647 @@@BSEP@@@ alone is sufficient to disrupt hepatic @CHEMICAL_Bile_Acids_and_Salts @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001647 @@@bile acid@@@ efflux. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Tamoxifen @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013629 @@@tamoxifen@@@ appear to be prototypes of a class of @GENE_ABCB11 @GENE_8647 @@@BSEP@@@ repressors that may cause drug-induced @<m>DISEASE_Cholestasis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002779 @@@cholestasis@@@ through gene repression instead of direct @GENE_ABCB11 @GENE_8647 @@@BSEP@@@ inhibition.

citations.NLM: Garzel B, Hu T, Li L, Lu Y, Heyward S, Polli J, Zhang L, Huang SM, Raufman JP, Wang H. Metformin Disrupts Bile Acid Efflux by Repressing Bile Salt Export Pump Expression. Pharm Res. 2020 Jan 6;37(2):26. PMID: 31907698

results.title: Metformin ameliorates bile duct ligation-induced acute hepatic injury via regulation of ER stress
results.text_hl: These results suggest that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ can inhibit UPR induced by @<m>DISEASE_Cholestasis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002779 @@@cholestasis@@@ in vivo.

results.title: Melatonin and metformin co-loaded nanoliposomes efficiently attenuate liver damage induced by bile duct ligation in rats.
results.text_hl: Histopathological analysis, biochemical analysis, and oxidative stress markers were assayed to determine the therapeutic effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Met@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Melatonin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008550 @@@Mel@@@ co-loaded liposomes on @<m>DISEASE_Cholestasis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002779 @@@cholestasis@@@.

results.title: Hepatotoxicity Induced by Fluvastatin: A Reversible Acute Cholestatic Liver Injury
results.text_hl: The Naranjo scale indicates a probable relationship between @DISEASE_Liver_Failure @DISEASE_MESH:D017093 @@@cholestatic liver injury@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Fluvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077340 @@@fluvastatin@@@, as well as a possible relationship between @<m>DISEASE_Cholestasis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002779 @@@cholestatic injury@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Gliclazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005907 @@@gliclazide@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@.

citations.NLM: Alanazi NS, Alenazi TS, Alenzi KA. Hepatotoxicity Induced by Fluvastatin: A Reversible Acute Cholestatic Liver Injury Am J Case Rep. 2021 Aug 12;22():e931418. PMID: 34383728

results.title: Reduced antidiabetic effect of metformin and down-regulation of hepatic Oct1 in rats with ethynylestradiol-induced cholestasis.
results.text_hl: In addition, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ did not demonstrate a @CHEMICAL_Glucose @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005947 @@@glucose@@@-lowering effect during IVGTT in EE @<m>DISEASE_Cholestasis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002779 @@@cholestasis@@@.
